ai.summary: Crowan BR 133 is a very short, easy hike covering 0.4 km on mostly flat terrain. The route is well suited for beginners, families with children, and anyone looking for a quick outdoor stretch in the UK. It offers a gentle countryside experience with minimal elevation and straightforward navigation.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily a flat grassy track with occasional compacted dirt. Expect potential mud after rain and short stretches near hedgerows or gates. Footing is generally good, but uneven patches can occur in damp conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Although the distance is short, plan for the weather and daylight. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Stay on marked paths, and close gates behind you. Be mindful of livestock and road crossings near the route. Carry a charged phone and let someone know your plans. Check for mud or ice in wet or winter conditions and adjust your pace accordingly.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing suitable for the season
Map or offline navigation and a charged phone
Sunscreen, hat, and sunglasses for sunny days
ai.best_seasons: All year, with the most comfortable conditions in spring and summer. In autumn and winter, expect wetter and muddier paths and shorter daylight; plan accordingly.

seo.title: Crowan BR 133: 0.4 km Easy Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Crowan BR 133, a short 0.4 km easy hike in the UK. Learn about terrain, safety tips, and gear to make the most of this quick countryside walk.
